results.title: Silver Blaze
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Classics Dark and Dangerous”.
Called in to solve the baffling case involving the famous racehorse, Silver Blaze, Sherlock Holmes and Watson arrive at the small village of Tavistock to discover that the police have already arrested a suspect. However the detective uncovers discrepancies. He retraces the events of the night of the crime and ultimately comes to a surprising solution. Cast includes Christopher Plummer.

results.title: The Rocking horse winner
results.creator_credit: Peter Medak, William Deneen, Learning Corporation of America and Highgate Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Classics Dark and Dangerous”.
Adapted from a novel by D.H. Lawrence about a young boy whose rocking horse empowers him to predict winning racehorses at the eventual cost of his life. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Classic Looney Tunes Cartoons
results.brief_description: Released as a 50th birthday tribute to Bugs Bunny, this series of videos are collections of classic Warner Bros. cartoons of all your favourite characters, from Daffy Duck to Porky Pig. Sit back and enjoy the fun-filled animation that is instantly recognisable and famous world-wide.

results.title: Stevie Wonder: songs in the key of life
results.creator_credit: David Heffernan, Bous De Jong, Daniel Television and Isis Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Classic albums: the greatest records in rock history”.
Taking more than two years from conception to release, ‘Songs in the key of life’ is considered to be one of the highlights of Stevie Wonder’s career, as well as one of the classic albums of the century. Originally released in 1976, the album entered the U.S Billboard album charts at number one and held the position for 14 weeks. Success also heralded Motown Records’ reinvestment in Wonder, resigning him to the label in a lucrative deal. The album was successful in the United Kingdom, reaching number two, remaining in the charts for over a year, and was a worldwide best seller. This outstanding success in 1976 culminated in the announcement that Stevie Wonder was the recipient of Album of the Year at the Grammys, as well as being named Producer of the Year and Best Male Vocal Performer. The remarkable story behind this phenomenally successful year for Wonder is told here as he reminisces about the inspiration behind the album.

results.title: The Jimi Hendrix Experience: electric ladyland
results.creator_credit: Roger Pomphrey, Bous De Jong, Nick de Grunewald, BBC, Experience Hendrix, Daniel Television and Isis Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Classic albums: the greatest records in rock history”.
Jimi Hendrix’s album “Electric Ladyland” is one of the classic rock albums of the 20th century. With songs like “Voodoo Chile”, “Crosstown Traffic”, “Gypsy Eyes”, and “All Along the Watchtower”, it has influenced countless rock guitarists. This documentary, part of the “Classic Album” series, examines both the recording process of the album as well as focusing on the life and legend of Jimi Hendrix. Examining each song on the album, the documentary intersperses interviews with Hendrix’s friends and musicians who played on the album, with footage of Hendrix both playing and being interviewed, photos (including Linda McCartney’s pictures for the album cover), and Hendrix’s notes and journals as well as lots of amazing music. People interviewed include Chas Chandler, Mitch Mitchell, Noel Redding, Buddy Miles, Dave Mason, Mike Finnigan, Steve Winwood and album engineer Eddie Krammer.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Roger Pomphrey, Bous De Jong, Nick de Grunewald, BBC, Experience Hendrix, Daniel Television and Isis Productions

results.title: The Band
results.creator_credit: Bob Smeaton, Caroline Thomas, This Band, Daniel Television and Isis Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Classic albums: the greatest records in rock history”.
The Band- comprising Rick Danko, Levon Helm, Garth Hudson, Richard Manuel and Robbie Robertson where initially known for supporting Bob Dylan on tour but they quickly became known as a band, The Band, within their own right. After signing with Capitol Records in 1968, they recorded eight U.S. Top 40 albums, including three million sellers. Out of all of the group’s albums, their eponymously titled 1969 album achieved Billboard success, was their second million seller, and is now regarded as a rock classic because of its careful blending of black, country, rockabilly and rock and roll music. The story of The Band and their classic album is recounted here in words, images and music, with contributions by rock legends Eric Clapton, George Harrison, Bernie Taupin and Don Was. Band members too offer an insight into the creative processes at work behind their albums that were universally popular.

results.title: Grateful Dead: anthem to beauty
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Marre, Grateful Dead Productions, Daniel Television and Isis Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Classic albums: the greatest records in rock history”.
The Grateful Dead, known for their experimentation and individual approach to music and performance have sustained a career in live performances since the mid 60’s (originating from the San Francisco Bay area). Infamous for their experimentation with music and hallucinogenic drugs, the band are also well known for their loyal fans (known as ‘deadheads’), who have travelled consistently with the band for 30 years. Priceless interviews recounting many humourous and bizarre tales are told in such a ‘matter of fact’ manner, chronicling their journey from experimental “Anthem of the Sun”, to the accessible “American Beauty”. Featuring interviews with core band members; Jerry Garcia, Phil Lesh, Bob Weir, Ron ‘Pigpen’ McKerman, Mickey Hart and Bill Kreutzmann, which includes amongst others a rare interview with lyricist Robert Hunte. Other contributors include David Crosby, biographer Dennis McNally, keyboard virtuoso Tom Constanten, producer Steven Barnaco, legendary engineer Dan Healy and Warner Records chief Joe Smith.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeremy Marre, Grateful Dead Productions, Daniel Television and Isis Productions

results.title: Romance and reality; Man the measure of all things
results.creator_credit: Ann Turner, Michael Gill, Peter Montagnon and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode numbers 3 and 4 of Series “Civilisation”.
Part 3: “Romance and reality” - Sir Kenneth journeys from a castle in the Loire, through the hill towns of Tuscany and Umbria to the cathedral baptistery at Pisa as he explores the aspirations and achievements of the later Middle Ages in France and Italy. Part 4. “Man the Measure of all Things” - Sir Kenneth visits Florence where European thought was first given a new impetus by the rediscovery of the classical past. He then continues his journey to the palaces of Urbino and Mantua, centres of Renaissance civilisation.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Ann Turner, Michael Gill, Peter Montagnon and BBC
